[b][color=#ffffff]Hack Forums Downtime and Fixes[/color][/b]
Due to a particular issue with the Hack Forums database after upgrading to MyBB 1.8x, many members found themselves furiously smashing their F5 key for most of Sunday. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999ff]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] has since resolved the issue and in result has made a series of improvements to Hack Forums.

[quote='Omniscient']
Search is vastly improved now and we even have a minimum 3 characters again. I have it set for 500 results which should be fine. More adjustment might be made as we go forward but overall everything is normal again and better than ever.
[/quote]

For those interested in further details regarding the downtime and fixes, please click [url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5810175&pid=56799995#pid56799995]here[/url].

[b][color=white]These Mice are Giving Unique Insights into the Domestication of Some Animals[/color][/b] 
As some of you may know, domesticated animals exhibit different features to their feral counterparts. We have traditionally associated these features, such as floppy ears on dogs or the curly tails on pigs, with human intervention. However, mice with the signs of domestication have appeared in the wild as well. The traits typically associated with domestication were first discovered by Charles Darwin and were called "domestication syndrome." The emergence of these traits was discovered entirely serendipitously. Brian Hare, with Duke University, was in the field for an unrelated study when he noticed the emergence of these features in his data. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.sciencemag.org/news/2018/03/self-domesticating-mice-suggest-some-animals-tamed-themselves-without-human]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Exercise in old age Protects Against Immune System Deterioration[/color][/b] 
Your doctors are always saying how you should be more active; now they will never stop.  According to Professor Norman Lazerous who both co-authored and participated in the study "If exercise was a pill, everyone would be taking it. It has wide-ranging benefits for the body, the mind, for our muscles and our immune system." For their study, the scientists took blood samples from cyclists, all over the age of 80, and tested them for their t-cell count. They found that these cyclists had comparable counts to samples taken from 20-year-olds. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/health-43308729]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New Type of ice Found in a Diamond[/color][/b] 
Scientists have found a type of ice not previously known to occur on Earth inside diamonds naturally found deep below the Earth's crust. Ice-VII, as it is commonly known, is almost twice as dense as the ice we all know and love. It also has a slightly different crystalline structure. It makes perfect sense this form of ice was found inside of a diamond, however.  There are many phases of ice, such as ice-II and ice-III, which are formed as ice is put under increasing amounts of pressure. What is interesting about ice-VII is that it is one of the few stable phases of frozen water. The researchers were fairly surprised to come across this, with Oliver Tschauner 
remarking "We were all very excited about that," [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-water-in-diamonds-20180308-story.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]This Mod Adds Fortnite's Building Tools to CS:GO[/color][/b] 
Battle Royal games are so popular that people are starting to create mods in other games to replicate them. Most recently a developer by the name of "Kinsi55" has created a CS:GO mod that allows you to replicate the Fornite video game. Titled, "Go 4 the Kill", the mod allows you to create stairs out of wood logs, just like in the popular Battle Royal game, Fortnite. A video was created showcasing the mod, however, it was very short with a timeframe of 30 seconds. Within the 30 seconds, you saw Kinsi55 creating the stairway to heaven with the wooden logs, but that was about it.  Some may look at it as stupid others may like it as a custom game. The mod is not out to the public yet and there is no information on whether or not Kinsi55 will be releasing it, as well as if there are any other features than building stairs. [b][color=white]PUBG Changes Coming Soon[/color][/b] 
A roadmap for the upcoming changes in PUBG was recently released on the [url=https://www.playbattlegrounds.com/news/130.pu]official website[/url] of the game. Brendan "PlayerUnknown" Greene, the video game designer for PUBG, states that the developers wish to release a cycle of new updates. The very first release being this month. The goal of these updates is to make the game as fun and enjoyable as it already is, as well as killing those annoying bugs you may have encountered and also by making the game as realistic as possible. One new thing that was shared on the PUBG official website was the announcement of an "Experimental Test Server", similar to the test server that is already in place. This server will allow you to test out the new cycle of what the developers may want to add to the game before doing so. They value your feedback so letting them know how you feel about something is critical to the future development of the game. A second thing that was discussed was the rendering of buildings. PUBG's art team has put together a model of what one house would look like with the new rendering. The before and after pic can be seen [url=https://content.invisioncic.com/r273030/monthly_2018_03/building.jpg.309cd52c6ff83ced3e584258f3c4cfbd.jpg]here[/url]. Those who are willing to test the Experimental Testing Server will have the chance to try out the new 4x4km island map. What makes this map interesting besides the size is how fast-paced the games will now be. The player limit will still be 100 so prepare yourselves when diving onto this island! It sounds like a lot of fun. If you wanna taunt and laugh at your dead enemies you soon can! There will be the implementation of an emote system with a wide variety of emotes to choose from. No information has been shared yet on the matter, but Brendan has mentioned that new game modes will be coming too in the future. If you are tired of driving that ugly old military jeep and using the M16, a new assortment of weapons and vehicles will also be in one of the new cycles that PUBG dishes out. In addition, new attachments too. One final thing for customization on the weapons is weapon skins. There is no public information on this yet, but they will be coming. PUBG's servers will continue to improve with security changes to fight off cheaters. Brendan states, "It is impossible to solve these problems once and for all, but our goal is to continuously improve in this regard. " You can read more about the upcoming updates in the link provided up above earlier. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.playbattlegrounds.com/news/130.pu]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
